info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:37AM EST until January 12 at 12:49AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... South Fork Catawba River At Lowell affecting Gaston County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Catawba River at Lowell. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Between 14 and 15.5 feet, The South Fork Catawba may be flooding several roads in the Cramerton area, including Cramer Mountain Rd. along Duharts Creek, Riverside Dr., 8th Ave. near the South Fork Masonic Lodge and adjacent park, and Greenwood Pl. near Lakewood Park. The Cramerton Fire Department, Cramerton Drug Company, and the South Fork Masonic Lodge may also flood. Floodwaters may be approaching the Cramerton Police Department parking lot. Impacts may be similar to those associated with flooding on March 21st, 2003. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM EST Wednesday was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.9 feet on 03/21/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM EST.
